column2: When it came to work, Anne was always on time, and at 12:40 P.M. she appeared from the Piccadilly end of the street.
column3: Not a Penny More, Not a Penny Less

column2: “I have received your name from the Skilled Women’s Agency together with their recommendation. I understand they know you personally. I shall be glad to pay you the salary you ask and shall expect you to take up your duties on August 8th. The train is the 12:40 from Paddington and you will be met at Oakbridge station. I enclose five pound notes for expenses."
A little ormolu clock in the outer corridor indicated twenty minutes to one. The car was due at one-fifteen. Thirty-five minutes: oh, to escape for only that brief period!
column3: Extremely Entertaining Short Stories (The Octave of Jealousy)
